13#ifndef MITH_SYNC_H
14#define MITH_SYNC_H
15
16#include "al_smp.h"
17#define MAX_CONNECTIONS 32
18
19typedef enum {
20 UNTYPED,
21 PRODUCER_CONSUMER,
22 CONTROL,
23 DATA
24} ee_connect_type;
25
26typedef struct ee_connect_requires_s
27{
28 unsigned int idx; /* Index for the connection */
29 char *type; /* Arbitrary string defining connection type */
30 int ifrom; /* Min index in define params requiring/allowing this connection, -1 for always */
31 int ito; /* Max index in define params requiring/allowing this connection, -1 for always */
32 char *dataset; /* Regular expression on the dataset that would allow/require this connection , NULL for always*/
33 int required; /* Indicates weather connection is required if index/dataset allow */
34 char *comment; /* Comment about this type of connection, NULL if none */
35} ee_connect_requires;
36
37typedef unsigned int ee_connect_handle;
38
39typedef struct ee_connection_s {
40 ee_connect_type type;
41 ee_connect_handle handle;
42 char *name;
43 unsigned int from;
44 unsigned int to;
45 al_mutex_t mutex;
46 al_cond_t signal;
47 void *data;
48 int gid;
49} ee_connection;
50
51/* Work item connection related functions.
52 These helper function are a way to use the connections to synchronize items.
53 The protocol works like this:
54 Item A --> Item B
55 Two connections are needed. The first connection is used to control B, the second is used to throttle A and pass data.
56 The first connection is referred to as CTRL.
57 The second connection is referred to as DATA.
58 The data on CTRL connection is initialized by A, and becomes "QUIT" when A is done working.
59 A owns the mutex on CTRL, and B owns the mutex on DATA.
60
61 Before starting work, A needs to init_ctrl() and B needs to lock_in().
62 Then, B needs to:
63 wait_prev_start(map,connections,channel);
64 and:
65 while (signal_in(map,connections,channel) != QUIT) {
66 wait_prev_ready(map,connections,channel);
67 buf=get_next(map,connections,channel);
68 .. do work on buf
69 }
70 A needs to:
71 ... create a buffer
72 wait_next_ready(map,connections,channel);
73 set_out(map,connections,buf,channel);
74 signal_out_ready(map,connections,channel);
75 And when done:
76 signal_out(map,connections,QUIT,channel);
77 wait_next_ready(map,connections,channel);
78*/
79/* Connections come in pairs (ctrl and data), helper struct to make core more readable */
80typedef struct map_ent_s
81{
82 int ctrl;
83 int data;
84} map_ent;
85
86typedef enum {
87 INVALID_SIG=0,
88 START=1,
89 CONTINUE=2,
90 ACK=3,
91 QUIT=5
92} signal_num;
93
94int chain_init_ctrl(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
95int chain_signal_in_ready(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
96signal_num chain_signal_in(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
97int chain_ready_in(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
98int chain_signal_out(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, signal_num sendme, int channel);
99int chain_wait_prev_ready(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
100int chain_wait_prev_start(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
101e_u8 *chain_get_next(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
102int chain_set_out(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, e_u8 *buf, int channel);
103int chain_signal_out_ready(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
104int chain_lock_in(map_ent *map_in, ee_connection **connections, int channel, int lock_state);
105int chain_lock_out(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, int channel, int lock_state);
106int chain_wait_next_ready(map_ent *map_out, ee_connection **connections, int channel);
107
108#endif /*MITH_SYNC_H*/
